bibl.title: Bunnell and Bunnell v. Isbell. Petition for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of Washington Territory and for the first Judicial District therof holding terms at the City of Colfax in and for the County of Whitman, said Territory
In the matter of the Application of Edgar Bunnell and Arthur Bunnell for Writ of Habeas Corpus} Petition for Writ
To the Honorable William G. Langford Associate Justice of the Supreme Branch of Washington Territory and Judge of the above entitiled Court

The petiiton of Edgar Bunnell and Arthur Bunnell respectfully shows that they the said Edgar Bunnell and Arthur Bunnell are imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of their lierty by William Isbell, Marshal of the town of Garfield is incorporated under and by virtue of an act of the Legislative Assembly of Washington Territory approved February 2" 1888 entitled "An Act For the Incorrporated of Iowas and Villages in the Territory"
